comment.author: 39967544@N00
comment._content: The White Star Line built the Ceramic in 1913, a giant liner then for the Australian service. It is shown here in Sydney Harbour during World War 1, it seems at anchor and probably waiting to carry troops to the conflict zones. It was torpedoed in 1942.

comment.author: 35317829@N06
comment._content:
Incredible photo, I have the feeling this was shot during WW1 because in the 30s she was refitted and the superstructure enlarged.
If this was taken in WW2 it could be one of the very last photos taken before she was sunk. There was only one survivor.
Cheers,
Phill

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/35317829@N06] thanks PhillMono, we have updated our records. :)
